questions.question: What is included in the total cost of ownership? (Choose two.)

comments.content: Page 468 Vancouver
Original cost + operational expense

the total cost of ownership (TCO) includes the following two components:

    Original cost: The original cost refers to the initial investment or purchase cost of an asset or service. It includes the cost of acquiring the item, such as the purchase price, licensing fees, implementation costs, and any associated setup expenses.

    Operational expense: Operational expenses are ongoing costs incurred during the operational lifecycle of an asset or service. These expenses include maintenance, support, upgrades, training, licensing renewals, and any other costs associated with the day-to-day operation and maintenance of the item.

Therefore, the two components included in the total cost of ownership (TCO) are:

   B. Original cost
    D. Operational expense
Answer is original cost and operational expenses

questions.question: When running an asset audit, you receive the result of 10 "Expected and not found" assets. What does this mean?

B. You scanned 20 assets in your inventory, but only 10 of them were on your expected inventory list.

Expected and not found = Number of expected assets that weren’t scanned.

D: 10 expected and not found; 10 new
=> both C and D have 10 expected and not found
